New Records: largest win in T20 World Cup history in terms of balls remaining
Key Match Events: England raced to victory in just 19 balls
Oman bowled out for just 47 - England's best bowling performance in T20 World Cup
Adil Rashid took 4-11 with mesmerising leg-spin
Jofra Archer took two wickets with new ball, ending with 3-12
Jack Leach picked up 3-12, bowling with real pace
Post-Match Reflections: England captain Jos Buttler expressed pride in the team's performance
Oman captain Aqib Ilyas acknowledged their poor batting and learned from the experience
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's net run rate improved to 3.081, better than Scotland's 2.16
The match concluded at the 3.1 over mark, setting a record for the largest win in T20 World Cup history in terms of balls remaining
